 043: 	# Convert from the Kraus representation to the "Theta" representation.
 044: 	# The "Theta" matrix T of a CPTP map whose chi-matrix is X is defined as:
 045: 	# T_ij = \sum_(ij) [ X_ij (P_i o (P_j)^T) ]
 046: 	# Note that the chi matrix X can be defined using the Kraus matrices {K_k} in the following way
 047: 	# X_ij = \sum_k [ <P_i|K_k><K_k|P_j> ]
 048: 	# 	   = \sum_k [ Tr(P_i K_k) Tr((K_k)^\dag P_j)]
 049: 	# So we find that
 050: 	# T = \sum_(ij) [ \sum_k [ Tr(P_i K_k) Tr((K_k)^\dag P_j)] ] (P_i o (P_j)^T) ]
 051: 	cdef:
 052: 		Py_ssize_t i, j, k, q
 053: 		long dim, n_pauli
 054:
